items.title: Smart Glasses Market Analysis 2025: A Vision of the Future
items.content: Market analysis consistently points toward explosive growth between now and 2025. Driven by falling component costs, maturing software ecosystems, and a post-pandemic emphasis on hands-free digital access, the compound annual growth rate (CAGR) is projected to be in the high double digits. The total market valuation, which rested in the low billions just a few years ago, is forecast to multiply several times over, potentially reaching a staggering figure that signifies its arrival as a major [...] Regionally, North America currently holds the largest market share, driven by strong enterprise adoption and the presence of major technology players. However, the Asia-Pacific region is expected to witness the highest growth rate through 2025. This is fueled by massive manufacturing hubs in China, South Korea, and Taiwan, a thriving consumer electronics market, and significant government investment in AR technology and 5G infrastructure across the region. [...] The stage is set, the players are in position, and the technology is rapidly maturing. The smart glasses market analysis for 2025 paints a picture of a technology transitioning from its awkward adolescence into a powerful and mature toolset. It will be a story of two parallel tracks: the continued, solid growth of enterprise applications delivering concrete business value, and the exciting, unpredictable emergence of consumer applications that will redefine how we see and interact with the

items.title: Eyes on the future: Smart glasses - Bank of America Institute
items.content: AI glasses, a type of smart eyeglasses that provide audio and visual capabilities to users, have gained traction since early 2024. With tech giants entering the space and shipments expected to exceed 10 million units in 2025, AI glasses are currently driving the smart glasses market â€” but consumer interest may fall as augmented reality (AR) glasses gain momentum. [...] #### Regional Roundup: Upswing in spending eludes the South Slower wage growth and a relatively weak tourism season appears to have restrained the southern economy. 2 min read september 2025 #### On the clock: Agentic AI in the workplace Enterprise adoption of agentic AI is in its early stages, but companies are laying the groundwork for increased investment. 2 min read [...] Read our full analysis for a more in-depth look at these trends. items.title: The Rise of Smart Glasses, From Novelty to Necessity | IDC Blog
items.content: Smart glasses are a rapidly growing market as technological advances are beginning to make the form factor viable. Further advances in technology, greater consumer awareness, and new entrants into the market will likely continue this growth into the long run (IDC is currently forecasting 18.7 million units in 2029 compared to 2.7 million units in our most recent full year of data 2024). A little way off the 1.44 billion mobile phones sold worldwide in 2024, but if there is any product [...] market for a discreet solution to help individuals with hearing loss and foreign language translation, which could create a significant tail wing for smart glasses sales. [...] ### Conclusion & Forecast

items.title: Electrochromic Materials Market Size & Share Analysis
items.content: The electrochromic materials market stands at USD 1.98 billion in 2025 and is projected to grow to USD 2.92 billion by 2030, advancing at an 8.06% CAGR. The growth reflects mandatory energy-efficiency codes, falling device costs, and rapid product commercialization across buildings, vehicles, and aircraft. Dynamic glazing lowers building cooling loads by up to 39.5%, positioning the electrochromic materials market as a preferred solution for net-zero construction. Cost breakthroughs have cut [...] Metal oxides accounted for 49.42% of 2024 revenue, anchoring the electrochromic materials market with proven tungsten-oxide stability. The segmentâ€™s cycling durability surpasses 100,000 cycles at 60 Â°C, and titanium-intercalated WOâ‚ƒ reaches 85% optical modulation and 95.61% reversibility. Conducting polymers trail yet post a 10.69% CAGR, propelled by PEDOT and polyaniline flexibility that suits rollable displays. MoSâ‚‚-doped PEDOT achieves 70.28% coloration depth, narrowing performance gaps. items.content: The global smart glass market size was valued at USD 7.07 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach from USD 7.83 billion in 2025 to USD 17.65 billion by 2033, growing at a CAGR of 10.7% during the forecast period (2025-2033). Factors such as surging demand for smart glass-based products and high adoption in the transportation sector, significantly drives the smart glass market demand by 2033. [...] The aerospace and transportation sector is projected to emerge as a major client for smart glass applicability, thereby contributing to market revenue. The commercialization of SPD smart glass has uncovered several opportunities, such as rearview mirrors, smart glass installations in side-view windows, and sunroofs. These glasses reduce the built-up heat within the vehicles due to their ability to block solar heat gain. SPD automotive rear and side windows and sunroofs greatly benefit [...] SPD glass's fast-switching features and infinite tuning features reduce unwanted glare and light, enabling users to enjoy not only the outdoor view but also the glare-free view of displays and video screens. The heat-blocking features improve fuel efficiency and reduce carbon emissions in vehicles. The majority of contemporary aircraft models encompass SPD windows. SPD windows block the cabin heat buildup, reduce maintenance costs, and block UV radiation to protect the interiors. Therefore,

Asia Pacific captures the majority share of the market, due to the expanding aftermarket sector and the increasing customer base in the area. [...] Based on type of technology, the automotive glass market is segmented into standard glass and smart glass. According to estimates, currently, the smart glass segment captures the majority of the market. This growth can be attributed to various types of smart glass, including electrochromic, Polymer Dispersed Liquid Devices (PDLC), and Suspended Particle Devices (SPD), along with their associated advantages.

Photochromic lenses, which adjust their tint based on the intensity of sunlight, are becoming increasingly popular among consumers for their convenience and eye protection benefits. The demand for photochromic eyewear, automotive components, and smart electronic devices is driving the market growth in this region. items.title: Chromic Materials Company Evaluation Report 2025 | Merck
items.content: Chromic materials are compounds that exhibit changes in color or properties when exposed to external stimuli such as light, heat, electricity, pressure, or gases. Key categories include photochromic materials, which react to light and are commonly used in eyewear; thermochromic materials, which respond to temperature changes and are applied in textiles and packaging; and electrochromic materials, which alter color under electrical input and are used in smart windows and mirrors. [...] Other types include piezochromic materials, which react to pressure, and gasochromic materials, which change properties when exposed to certain gases. The market for chromic materials is expanding due to growing interest in energy-efficient and smart technologies, although high production costs and complex manufacturing processes remain significant challenges. Continued research and development are broadening their applications in sustainable and adaptive technologies across multiple [...] Displays and screens leverage electrochromic and photochromic effects to enable dynamic visuals, and photochromic materials in ophthalmic lenses adjust tint according to light conditions. These applications are powered by fundamental chromic technologies, including photochromism (light sensitivity), thermochromism (temperature sensitivity), electrochromism (response to electrical input), piezochromism (pressure sensitivity), gasochromism (gas detection), and other advanced chromic mechanisms -

items.title: Chromic Materials Market, Industry Size Forecast Report [Latest]
items.content: Thermochromism accounts for the largest market share, based on technology, in the chromic materials market due to its application in various industries. Thermochromic materials change color upon a change in temperature and have widespread applications in smart windows, apparel, package structures, and consumer products for functional as well as esthetic uses. They improve energy efficiency and user experience; they also offer visual indications, thereby making them very modern and sustainable. [...] Chromic materials are materials that display reversible color changes on exposure to some external stimulus like light, temperature, electricity, solvents, or mechanical operations. Some of the examples of such materials are photochromic materials responding to light, thermochromic materials responding to temperature variations, and electrochromic materials responding to electrical currents. Chromic effects find extensive use in areas such as anti-counterfeiting, data storage, fabrics, and [...] The longevity of chromic materials, particularly for outdoor or high-exposure use, is another significant restraint to the market. Chromic materials exhibit reversible property change with light, heat, or electricity exposure, but over time, their ability to do so can be lost due to chronic exposure to erosive ambient conditions such as UV, temperature, and humidity. For example, photochromic devices used in self-darkening windows or glasses may start to lose efficacy in color change after

items.title: Smart Glass and Smart Window Market Size & Forecast, 2034
items.content: The Global Smart Glass and Smart Window Market was valued at $6.7 billion in 2024, and is projected to reach $29.7 billion by 2034, growing at a CAGR of 16.5% from 2025 to 2034. Smart glass, also known as smart windows, intelligent glass, or switchable glass, is an advanced product that can change its optical properties in response to external stimuli or user commands. When activated, these next-generation adaptive glass adjust the glass's light transmission, enabling privacy control, glare [...] The smart glass and smart window market is further segmented by end user, with key industries including automotive, aviation, marine, and construction. The construction sector held the largest smart glass and smart window market in 2024 and is projected to grow at a significant compound annual growth rate (CAGR) from 2025 to 2034. [...] The smart glass and smart window industry is anticipated to expand significantly during the forecast period, owing to a surge in demand for smart glass-based products in the construction sector. This technology is increasingly adopted due to its energy efficiency and aesthetic appeal, which can reduce energy consumption. Smart glass helps regulate light and heat transmission, thus enhancing the comfort and sustainability of both commercial and residential buildings.

items.content: NGA staff and consultants went to Capitol Hill last week to meet with federal legislators to discuss expanding the investment tax credit for high-performance windows. Currently, Section 48 of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) includes an investment tax credit only available for electrochromic glass. NGAâ€™s request is to expand the types of high-performance windows eligible for the investment tax credit to also include other types of dynamic glass, as well as triple glazing and vacuum insulated [...] glazing (VIG). NGA is also requesting an extension on the deadline of the credit, which is set to expire on Jan. 1, 2025. Any construction needs to begin before that date to be eligible. [...] Expanding glass eligibility and extending the deadline can give building owners more high-performance window options and yield more opportunity to receive the tax credit to offset costs. It would also have a favorable impact on energy efficiency and the electrical grid, and translate into more manufacturing, fabricating and installing work for the entire glass and glazing supply chain.
